item.name: 6 nimmt!
item.comment: A fun game, quick to play, not much strategy in it. Very random with large numbers of players but quick and very popular as a filler game.

item.name: 7 Ages
item.comment: Got a quick demo of this at Essen 2004. I'm a big fan of big Civ-type games like this, and I dont know if it was the demo that was bad, but the game just didnt work. We had some players who couldnt even start playing at the start of the game. Combat was on dice and was "I win: you lose *all* your armies, I lose none" Was looking forward to this game and horribly disappointed. Prepared to be convinced otherwise if anyone buys it, forces me to play it and tell me that we were playing it all wrong.

item.name: Acquire
item.comment: I'm no good at this game, but its good mechanics.

item.name: Advanced Civilization
item.comment: Fixes a lot of problems with the original game, making it even better. Will never play without it. Finally found a copy after 10 years of looking!

item.name: Age of Exploration
item.comment: Very unclear rules, not much player interaction, very random, not really a "game", more of a simulation. It would be fun if I could only understand the rules.

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment: Good game, popular at our local club. My rating of 6 is because I'm no good at it. A bit too much long term planning in it for me, looking at the cubes and making the big routes for late game.

item.name: Alba Longa
item.comment:
Worst game we played at Essen 2011. All four of us didnt like it at all and we stopped playing after 2 turns.
There were some great games at Essen 2011. There were also some good games. This was neither.
The art was not good, and the dice often landed on their edge and didnt roll. Simple 8 sided dice would have been better.

item.name: Alexander the Great
item.comment: Played it once in Essen 2005. Played ok, but what you do and whether it works depends on the other players and you can get badly screwed quite easily we found (5 player game). Not sure if anyone bought it, may have to play it again to get a more informed decision

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Nice game, but I dont ever want to play it 5 or 6 player as I just dont think it works. 2,3 or 4 player is good though, although if you are lucky enough to get the right cards for the right buildings you are laughing, so quite a high luck element I found

item.name: Antike
item.comment: Good game, short and it works. Not sure how well playtested the starting positions are as it looks like that can really influence the game

item.name: Antiquity
item.comment: Its a computer resource management game transferred to a boardgame. Not much player interaction, can be a bit fiddly. Still not even sure if there is much of a game in this

item.name: Aquarius
item.comment: Only played it the once but didn't like it. Draw cards, play cards, not much thought or strategy and not that much fun

item.name: Asking for Trobils
item.comment: Was disappointed by this. Was expecting it to be better. More style over substance. The basic principle was just go somewhere, get stuff, go somewhere else, change stuff into other stuff, collect stuff. Nothing new, exciting or clever in any way. The cards were a bit random. And also, the pirates and courtesans were just fiddly. Standups on the board, not clear which is which, just didn't really work that well.

item.name: Attika
item.comment: My second favourite game on BSW. I just really like it. Can be tricky with the real game to remember what you have built, which BSW does for you :)

item.name: The Awful Green Things From Outer Space
item.comment: A bit of fun, rather than a tactiacl balanced game. A good laugh to play. Low quality game components

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: I love WW2 games. I also love empire building, getting resources for areas controlled types of games. I love games with lots of nice pieces. The only drawback with this game is that it may all be over in a couple of turns if one side is lucky with dice rolls.

item.name: Azteca
item.comment: Not too bad, lots of different mechanics and interesting mechanism in that you sacrifice slaves at the end of each turn to one of the 2 gods. If not enough sacrifices are made to Tezcatlipoca, the game ends and everyone loses. If the game doesn't end this way, then the one with the most sacrifices to Quetzecotl wins. So you have to be careful when dividing your slaves, not enough to Tezcatlipoca and no-one wins.

item.name: The Big Cheese
item.comment: Very simple game, not much too it at all and a bit random

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment: I really want to like this game, but I just dont get it. Spent so much time on it, playing it and learning it, but it seems little more than draw cards and play them. Very few choices to be made during the game, just do the best you can with the cards.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: A great game with more depth than just a simple card game.

item.name: Bremerhaven
item.comment:
Wow. How could I have been so wrong. From everything I read pre-essen, before the rules came out, this was my #1 game. A complex economic simulation game.
Then the rules came out and it had blind bidding in it. Then I played it and it got even worse.
My worst game of Essen 2013. I very, very rarely get rid of any of my games, but this one, I did get rid of.
Where to start. First of all, the game has so many flaws, it wasn't even worth the effort of trying to tweak it. The blind bidding is nonsense and really doesn't work. The designer said it is fun - no its not. I don't want blind bidding in a complex economic game.
The designer said "some spaces you can still use if you are second". And yes, this is ok. But that's 2 out of 13 spaces - not many at all.
You bid on contracts, you then have to bid on the ships that provide the goods. If they don't come out, or you don't get them, you're screwed.
The trucks don't move even when they have all their goods - they just sit there until their time runs out - this is a nonsense game mechanic which everyone hated.
When you sell goods, unless you went on the space to manipulate the price, its basically totally random how much you will get. It could be something like 4 or 12. So money coming into people was basically random.
The prestige point thing was an interesting idea but failed completely. Since only final prestige matters, any gains you gain early game from ships is totally pointless.
The components are awful. Fiddly little counter and stupid jigsaw shaped board pieces that just don't work.
I could go on.....
The lack of activity on BGG following this games release is justified. This is not a complex economic game, its just a mash of nonsense game mechanics that might sound ok, but are not.

item.name: Briefcase
item.comment:
A few of us played this at Essen. One of our least favourite games. The artwork is meh, graphic design could have been a lot better, but more importantly, the game itself was, well... just, nothing really.
You just buy lots of buy cards. You need them to buy new buildings. But to activate the buildings you need resources, which you get with buy cards...
Didnt like the obstacle cards really, and moving the block on the resources didnt seem to work well.
A game none of us would choose to play again.

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
Canterbury
item.comment: Was very keen to get this, and paid quite a bit for it at Essen. It's ok - nothing wrong with it, but just a bit disappointing. It got a few plays, nothing more.

item.name: Capitol
item.comment: Tactical game. Slight random element which can really mess your game up through no fault of your own. There are 3 regions in which to build houses and you can only build in a region if you have the right coloured card. If you draw a number of cards and they are all the same colour, then you're pretty screwed if you wanted to build somewhere else.

item.name: Car Wars (fifth edition)
item.comment: Another SJG style game unfortunately. Loved playing the earlier editions years ago, but this was just awful. The rules just didnt work, nothing seemed balanced, not a very well put together game at all. Shame, because the earlier versions were cool.

item.name: Car Wars: The Card Game
item.comment: Very simple card game, draw cards, shoot your opponents car up. No real thought or strategy involved. Snooze

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Simple game really, draw a tile, place a tile. Bit simple unless played with Pauls optional rules, which at least give the player some choice of what to play.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: Not a big fan of Carcassonne, but this one was Knizia :)

item.name: Castle Merchants
item.comment: Light game, so low rating for me because light games dont generally do it. Limited replay value, limited strategy and a lot down to the cards you get. Nice 'stitch your mates' elements though. Board design and tiles nice, cards awful and production quality of player boards bad. Overpriced at 30euro. 12 of us went to Essen 2005, nobody bought it.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Will not play with the dice :)

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: As time has gone on, I'm having to downgrade to a 9. Whilst still a masterpiece, there are other games I prefer to play more now.

item.name: Chez Dork
item.comment: Nothing more than a fun game, simple mechanics, artwork and flavour text is the best part of the game. No real strategy, just draw cards and play them. Too expensive, rules not completely clear

item.name: Chez Geek
item.comment: Another SJG fun game, simple mechanics, artwork and flavour text is the best part of the game. No real strategy, just draw cards and play them. Boring after a while.

item.name: Chinatown
item.comment: Negotiation game, but you gotta get dealt the right tiles and the right pieces in the first place. Not too keen on the random extra points cards, which if you were lucky enough to build the right buildings, you get a bonus.

item.name: Chrononauts
item.comment: Nice idea, but it just doesn't work for me, tends to be completely random who wins (like Flux)

item.name: Chupacabra: Survive the Night
item.comment: Light and random, but a fun filler and party game.

item.name: La Città
item.comment: Underrated and not very well known game. Excellent to play

item.name: Civilization
item.comment: It's not everyone's cup of tea, but if you enjoy spending 10 hours+ with 6 of your mates playing a game like me it's great. Start with 1 token and develop your civilisation. Empire building game but with brilliant game balancing mechanics, making it more difficult to maintain a large empire

item.name: Clash of Cultures
item.comment: It's a very solid, clever game. But... too fiddly and random for me. A bit too long for what it is (and I don't mind long games). Lots of my friends like it, but I've tried it a number of times now and just cant get on with it.

item.name: Comuni
item.comment: Underrated game IMO. Really nice.

item.name: Concept
item.comment: Great family game, suitable for all occasions. Gamers like it too.

item.name: Container
item.comment:
Terrible components, warped boards, bad pieces. See my review for more details. Nice idea but not much substance to the game.
Horribly flawed game, totally broken - A player can get knocked out early and nothing they can do about it.
And if two players make an agreement, the game completely breaks.

item.name: Core Worlds
item.comment:
Sort of an ok ish game. Nothing special. Actual artwork is nice, but the graphic design of the cards is pretty amateur.
The biggest shock is this has just come out and I have seen the RRP. £45. That is very bad. This is a card game with a couple of extra bits, and it isnt a great card game at that. Absolutely nowhere near worth anything near that. Should be half this price.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: And old classic, but totally random for me.

item.name: Craftsmen
item.comment: Solid game let down by a bad translation of the ruleset.

item.name: Cthulhu Dice
item.comment: Another pointless SJG item. Not really a game.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Dicemaster: Cities of Doom
item.comment: Actually a lot of fun.

item.name: Diplomacy
item.comment: The classic game of making deals and then breaking them. I'm rubbish at it. Works great as a PBM game, but as a board game can be too long and boring for some

item.name: Doge
item.comment: Played this at Essen 2001, the day after playing San Marco. Both games are about getting control of Venice, and we preferred San Marco. The bidding mechanism is interesting, but it's possible to get completely screwed after the first couple of turns through no fault of your own. Would have to play it again to confirm my initial thoughts

item.name: Dominant Species
item.comment: Very solid heavy euro game. Wargame done right. Excellent with 6 players too.

item.name: Dominant Species: The Card Game
item.comment: Very disappointing. A simple random card game with the DS theme pasted on. Great quality components, but a game where everyone who played in unanimously agreed to not play again.

item.name: Dragon Pass
item.comment: OK, I've never played this game, but it looks great. It's essentially a fantasy wargame, but set in Glorantha. It has pre-defined scenarios, the easiest of which only use the basic rules. One day I will play this game. Thanks to Steve for lending it me for so long he forgot I had it :)

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment:
Another superb game from CGE. I had chance to read the rules for this and know a bit about it before release. It looked fantastic. This was my most anticipated game at Essen. When I picked it up, I was very pleased. Quality of the components excellent, everything just spot on.
Played it on the Thursday night at Essen. Was actually even more fun than I thought it would be :)
My favourite game of Essen 2009 - Though only just because Shipyard is excellent too.

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment: Top quality game. Excellent mechanics throughout that all fit together nicely to make a game that can sometimes melt your brain but is great fun.

item.name: DungeonQuest
item.comment: A fun game, very random, but lots of fun to play (as I remember). If anyone gets out alive (which is unlikely), it's the one with the most treasure that wins

item.name: Dungeonquest: Catacombs
item.comment: Unfortunately, this expansion added too much, and made the game a bit tricky compared to the lots of fun that can be had with just the basic game alone.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: This one is just a work of genius. Dice rolling for combat normally puts me off most games, but this is so elegant and design and production that I happily play this game - until the dice hate me and then I swear to never play again :)

item.name: Elevator Eddie
item.comment: Good fun quick game

item.name: Elfengold
item.comment: This expansion to Elfenland makes the original better in my opinion and more tactical. I can't see me wanting to play this game again without this expansion

item.name: Entdecker
item.comment: There seems to be 2 versions of this game, I played the new one at Essen 2001 and that's the one we have in our play group. From what I've seen, the new version is better than the old one.

item.name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri
item.comment:
I know people have different opinions on games, and everything is subjective. But, the people giving this game a 10 and saying how utterly amazing it is must be living on a different planet.
The component quality is beyond awful. NSKN have admitted this but are now making people pay £30 to get a replacement pack to fix their mistake.
The rules are not only awful, but the gameplay is just horrendous. Fiddly, badly designed rules which appear to have not been properly tested since those of us that tried to play this game found it unplayable.
One of the worst purchases I made and glad to have managed to sell it on.

item.name: Factory Fun
item.comment: Not normally into fun games, but this one is actually really good. 4 weeks after Essen 2006, it was our most played game (mainly because its a filler game). Enjoyed by non-gamers too.

item.name: Federation Commander: Klingon Border
item.comment:
Very tactical game but very unclear and badly written rules - points values for ships that are not balanced and very, very badly written scenarios that quite clearly havent been playtested because even some of the instructions on how to set up the board dont work!
A real shame, because fundamentally this could be a very good game, but it is lacking a bit of looking after to make sure things are correct.

item.name: A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment: Really nice idea and good mechanics. However....broken game which needed officially fixing by the designer. And the new rules are just as badly broken but in a different way.

item.name: Fire & Axe: A Viking Saga
item.comment: Didnt really like this game so I sold it as I probably wasnt ever going to play it again.

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: This game is a bit of fun and totally random. People love it or hate it. Games can last 2 minutes or half an hour, but you may aswell roll dice to decide who wins, it's that random

item.name: Formula Dé
item.comment: A good racing game with a bit of skill that can all be ruined by a couple of bad dice rolls.

item.name: Formula Motor Racing
item.comment: A fun game, not much to think about, draw cards, play cards, try and win the race. Nice simple design

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: For what it is, the game is perfect.

item.name: A Game of Thrones (first edition)
item.comment: Nice game, mostly like diplomacy (which I dont like), but this game plays well. Only played it twice up to now though. No dice to resolve the combat, which is always a good sign. The only bit I didnt like was the imbalance in the 5 players. Some positions are just better than others. I also didnt like the randomness of the cards coming out - came up with a house rule for this, which then appeared in the expansion set. :)

item.name: A Game of Thrones: A Clash of Kings Expansion
Genoa
item.comment: I'm starting to think that the ownership markers are way too powerful, but this is a great game. Edit - I'm now even more convinced that the ownership markers are way too powerful.

item.name: Glass Road
item.comment: Plays nicely, and quick. After quite a few plays though, seems more random than I initially thought.

item.name: Goa
item.comment: Excellent game, though I will never play it without 'Pauls optional rule' (Colonist cards always worth 2), since this random element can completely screw the game for you on round 1. Played it a few times now with this optional rule and it is a lot better

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: A well designed, balanced game it seems. Gets played now and again.

item.name: The Great Space Race
item.comment: Flawed game in places. Nice idea, could have been implemented a lot better. Too expensive and components not that great for the price

item.name: Greenland
item.comment:
Some people like Phil's games. I don't. I've tried some of them in the past and hated them. For me, they are not really games. So, it was no surprise that I didn't like this one.
His games seem to be more simulations, and I knew that going into the game, but the graphic design on the cards and the dice-rolling mechanics for me went out of fashion 30 years ago. Way too random. Random dice, random events, and way too long.
I send some cubes onto a space, and then roll dice to see if I succeed or not. Yeah, no surprise I wasn't going to like it.

item.name: Hacker: Deluxe Edition
item.comment: Typical SJG good theme but completely random game.

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: Brilliant Game

item.name: Helvetia
item.comment: Love a game where you can go to sleep, wake up to find you've been married and had kids.

item.name: Historia
item.comment: Some great ideas in the game, the card play is interesting, and the matrix is a really neat idea. I do feel there are still some 'rough edges' in the game however, needing a bit more development maybe. Also, iconography is not that clear and could have been better.

item.name: Imperial
item.comment: Bit of a surprise this one. 'By the guy who did Antike', so initially just thought it was a similar game but in Europe. Bought it based on that, it turned out to be a much much better game. Antike is ok, but this is outstanding. Was the final game in the Hemel Games Club tournament 2007, which was chosen based on peoples votes.

item.name: In the Shadow of the Emperor
In the Year of the Dragon
item.comment: Best game from Essen 2007 IMO. Really great game. However, after many online plays, it seems that the player who goes first and spends 6 on a double-dragon thingy usually wins. This has put me off a bit.

item.name: Infiltration
item.comment: Nothing really to this game. Just a random dealing of cards. Almost no decisions to make. Just a light filler game but I was expecting something a bit more.

item.name: Java
item.comment: A good game, but it does your head in. 6 action points per turn - how hard can it be? Very

item.name: K2
item.comment: The blocking rule just doesnt work for me. Seems out of place in an otherwise very thematic game. In 2 out of 3 games I've played, 2 players could do nothing for 4 turns, leading to a very bad play experience. Game works much better with a tweaked blocking rule and is much more enjoyable to play.

item.name: Kings & Things
item.comment: Can go on for ages

item.name: London
item.comment:
Will no longer play the game without rule tweaks due to 'broken' strategy. Even then it is just dull.
Everything is simply just points. You take a loan for 10 and pay it back for 15, or it is worth -7VP at the end. Since 3 cash is 1 point, then if you take a loan and dont pay it back, it is simply -3.7VP. If you do pay it back it is -1.7VP.
Poverty seemed interesting at first except for the fact that this has no effect on the game at all, except it gives you -VP at the end of game.
So, when you look at buildings, some of them give a mix of cash, poverty and VP, but in the end, all of that just easily translates to points.
Some of the buildings are just clearly better than others. Some are broken. If you get 2xOmnibus's you will proabably win.
But it is the fact that the building boroughs and discarding cards wins every game, that everyone needs to do it, meaning that all the A cards might aswell be blank.
Very much a rushed out game, must have missed some proper playtesting and just an all round disappointment. Probably the worst purchase I made in 2011. Sorry Martin.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
item.comment: Just a really good game for 2 players. Played it lots, still enjoy playing it now.

item.name: Lost Valley
item.comment: Better than I thought it would be. Bit complicated at first because you have so many things you can do. Read the FAQ before playing.

item.name: Louis XIV
item.comment: Tricky game, lots to think about. Only downsides I found first few plays were that accomplishing the missions early on gives you an advantage over the others. And some missions are really good if you are lucky to get them. Can also rely on the cards you get dealt. But nice game

item.name: Luna
item.comment: Brilliant game. My favourite from Essen 2010

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment: Wanted to play it for years. Very heavy (I like that), but horribly random. Will probably never play it again

item.name: Madeira
item.comment:
My favourite game from 2013.
Heavy going at first, but it does flow well and all makes sense, with enough variability that each game is different.

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment:
Luckily enough to be sent the files to create a prototype of this game before it came out. Now that I own the actual copy, I am extremely happy.
This is one of the games I've waited my whole life for. I normally hate games where you go around killing things and getting xp because they are normally dice rolling and luck based. This one isnt. It combines the best bits of other games, gels them all well together.
It has well constructed game mechanics, a very clever combat mechanic which acts as a kind of puzzle. The replayability is the best I have ever seen in a game. You can play this game competitively, coop, solo. You can choose whether to turn on Player vs Player combat or not. The game comes packed with 11 scenarios and multiple variant rules already built in that you really can play this game however you want to.
Play time can be a turn off, because this game has a big rulebook and is moderately complex. And a full first game might take about 6 hours, but the play time drops drastically with each play, coming down to 3-4 hours.
Epic game. Thankyou Vlaada.
Unfortunately, some players of the original Mage Knight game are going to rate this game poorly because it isnt anything like the original game. Oh look, there we are, someone has already rated the game low although he has never played it and doesnt know anything about it but is upset that he cant use his old Mage Knight figures :)

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game: The Lost Legion
Mage Wars Arena
item.comment:
Dice for combat is too random, so I play with a variant that reduces the luck factor massively and allows for more tactical play.
The only flaw with the game is that so many games just end up with a big fight in one space, which the game cannot cope with.

item.name: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
item.comment: Beyond initial order of the city pieces, no randomness. Plays nicely.

item.name: Merchant of Venus
item.comment: A classic, that for some reason I really like. The holy grail of merchant games. I only play with non-random movement variant.

item.name: Middle-Earth
item.comment: Rules too complicated for casual play. Plus dice rolling I'm not too keen on. Games also seem to take 3-4 hours per game. However, artwork is the best I've seen on any CCG and I've actually really enjoyed the games. Travelling around, fighting monsters, collecting items. All good :)

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: A typical SJ game. Nice fun idea, not well playtested, bad rules. Fun a few times thanks to the artwork but after that a bit boring.

item.name: Mythotopia
item.comment:
Bland Game that really didn't work for us and would never choose to play it again. The silly names on the board had us laughing AT the game. General artwork was functional but nothing special and again, very bland.
Got no feeling of any theme at all, was just complete abstract, moving pieces and trying to get a higher number - and that was pretty much the whole game. It was just lacking in... well, everything.
The wooden pieces in the limited edition were nice though, except the VP counters - I thought they looked a bit cheap. Silver paint with a printed black number off centre.
I also feel a bit more attention to detail on certain things like the player aid would have helped. Having a list of all the actions is useful, but there should have been at least some icons to show "This action must be first" or "You may only do this once".

item.name: Netrunner
item.comment: In my opinion, still the best CCG I've ever played. Shame that there just wasnt the player base for it.

item.name: Origins: How We Became Human
item.comment: Some nice elements and 'some' good mechanics, but others that just dont seem to work at all well and I think the game has a couple of flaws which seriously affect gameplay. A shame, because it seemed there is a lot of good stuff in there, it just didnt gel well together and didnt really enjoy it at all. Others I spoke to said the same, so this one will never see a play again.

item.name: Parthenon: Rise of the Aegean
item.comment: Way too random

item.name: Phoenicia
item.comment: Games should be better produced thesedays... Confusing rulebook. Clunky rules. Poorly designed board, poorly designed cards (huge pointless picture and tiny important text). You need a few plays to learn the tricks. Once everyone is on the same level and you can get past the bad design, its an ok game.

item.name: Pictomania
item.comment: Vlaada does a 'party' game. But as usual, he does it nicely with a clever scoring system. Pictionary for gamers.

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
PitchCar
item.comment: Nothing more than flipping little counters around a track. Great for conventions and a bit of fun, but not something I would choose to play above a proper game

item.name: Pizarro & Co.
item.comment: Nice game. Drag it out every few months and still enjoy it now.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: Mechanics work well. Unfortunately, the end game turn can be decided by whether the right thing comes up or not and you can win/lose based on this.

item.name: The Princes of Florence
item.comment: First of the more strategic abstract games we played, so it holds a special place for me. Very nice game, five years on and it still gets played.

item.name: Progress: Evolution of Technology
item.comment:
Absolutely nothing new here. Dull game. Played once, and the game played me. I just drew cards and if I was lucky to draw the right ones that chained for free, I played them.
Simply nothing to the game, very boring, made very few decisions.
Nice concept as an idea for the game but badly implemented.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Little more can be said about this game that hasnt been said already.

item.name: Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
item.comment: Apart from a slightly broken combo, I think this adds extra to an already excellent game. Playing with a mix of buildings, players have to adopt different strategies based on the buildings available.

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment:
If you accept that this is a quick, fun game with randomness but some choice, then it is fine.
Except the base game is totally broken and should only be played with the expert variant, which actually makes it playable.

item.name: Quo Vadis?
item.comment: Nice little game.

item.name: Ra
item.comment: I do like the game, but its a bit random at times. Quick to play, but very overrated on the geek

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Railway Rivals
item.comment: Should be played with Average Dice

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: Nothing wrong with this game. It is a fun game but works really well and very nicely designed.

item.name: Russian Railroads
item.comment: Excellent game. Best from Essen 2013 IMO

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment: Nice short game, still not sure of the best plays

item.name: San Marco
item.comment: I still quite like this game, but I think an 'average' dice (2,3,3,4,4,5,6) should be used for the banishment cards as this can be a bit too much of a random element.

item.name: The Scepter of Zavandor
item.comment: I like the game, but.... A couple of things should had been tweaked with the game components. Gem cards should have been coloured on the back so you know which discard pile to put them in. Gems should have the VP on the front so you can see, not the back. Little things - but would make it easier to play.

item.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective
item.comment: This isn't a normal game. The basic set has 10 cases and once you've done them that's it, you cant do them again, but it is one of the best games ever. I have run this game at various clubs with teams of people competing against each other to get the most points in the quiz at the end of the case. The cases are well thought out, and the atmosphere of Holmes' Victorian London is captured very well.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Space Alert
item.comment: Awesome Game. Brilliant design. Excellent production quality. Vlaada and the CGE team have done it again.

item.name: Space Alert: The New Frontier
item.comment: Just never really get to play properly because of the learning curve and always having a different group of players.

item.name: Star Realms
item.comment: It's a re-branded Ascension that is a bit of fun and quick to play. I find it 80% luck and really don't get what the mass appeal of the game is except for the fact that it is quick.

item.name: Star Trek: Expeditions
item.comment: Very disappointing. Cant believe this is a Reiner game. Very limited replayability, just the same thing over again.

item.name: Suburbia: Essen SPIEL Expansion
item.comment: unfortunately, a promo which can imbalance the game a lot.

item.name: Supremacy
item.comment: I got this game way back when. Wanted a long complex global wargame. Game is just awful and doesn't work at all. Goes on too long, and is very random. Expansion sets just add more randomness. This is a very old-school game, and should stay in the 80's.

item.name: Taj Mahal
item.comment: I like this game better than most, but its one of the few games which I always seem to do really well at :) Good solid Knizia game.

item.name: Talisman
item.comment: Spent half my life playing this when I was younger. Now I wouldnt touch it with a bargepole :)

item.name: Tempus
item.comment: This game gets slated for being awful, but I quite like it :)

item.name: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
item.comment: Fixes all the issues I had with the original game, which I thought was great, but this is even better.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: Giving this game a 9, since I am very reluctant to give out 10's. Great game and a must buy for anyone who likes Civ-based games. Clever design and beautiful game mechanics. Everytime I play it, even though the game is 6-8 hours) I want to play it again straight away.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Good as a family game and for teaching non-boardgamers how to play games (which is why I own it). Not enough to it for me though to play seriously, too much randomness

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: A bit of a classic, staple Knizia game, not my favourite of his games. You can get screwed if you are unlucky the right tiles, and critical game win/lose things can depend on the luck of whether someone else has the right tiles at the right time. I've won games by doing nothing and just being lucky enough to have just the right tiles when attacked

item.name: Tikal
item.comment: Not a bad game, got it early when I got into the boardgames. Not been played for a while now as there are much better games out there, so it doesnt get a look in.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: Nice game, very good components (but then again, the price justifies that). Needs a few tweaks IMO. Secret objectives are very imbalanced and I might play without next time. Also suggest playing with the optional rule whereby all the public objectives in the game are laid out ahead of time.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shattered Empire
item.comment: Fixes a lot of the problems with the original game

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: Nice mechanics, but way too random.

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment:
Not just another worker placement game. You can place, or take off. When you place, you can place different numbers of workers, in different locations and the longer you leave them there the better.
I dont have another game like this, but if someone knows of one, please let me know as I really like it.
Played over a hundred games whilst playtesting it and dont think I will ever tire of playing it as it is such a clever game.

item.name: Uchronia
item.comment: Played once. Very confusing. Not very intuitive I found, just randomly moving cards around. Not my type of game.

item.name: Urban Sprawl
item.comment:
It seemed fun to play. However, myself and most people I have played with found the game totally random due to complete chaotic random events. You have no idea which buildings will or will not come out in a game, and you have no idea which events will come out, you cant really plan ahead at all or have any kind of strategy.
Downtime is high because the cards on offer change so quickly that you cant think ahead at all of what you want to do on your turn until it gets to you.

item.name: Urland
item.comment: Some nice elements. Mutation cards artwork nice too.

item.name: Vinci
item.comment: Better than Small World IMO.

item.name: Vinhos
item.comment: Love the heaviness of this game, but having now played it a few times, and watching the same opening strategy win each time, its lost some of the magic.

item.name: Warrior Knights
item.comment: Loved this when younger, played it a bit and remembered it well. Now, things have changed and I'm more into the non-random games now, and we tried this again and there is just way too much randomness in it, so its back on the shelf

item.name: Wealth of Nations
item.comment: Original game was a bit flawed and needed a few tweaks to the rules, but now pretty good game.

item.name: Witchcraft
item.comment: Very disappointing. played once. That was enough - bad purchase.

item.name: Wizard Kings
item.comment: A couple of nice ideas, but some fundamental flaws which end up in the game being prone to dragging or stalemate. Bad rules, expensive for what you get. Bad purchase

item.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
item.comment: Better than M:tG. Fact.

item.name: X-Bugs
item.comment: A bit of fun really, but thanks to this game, I met my girlfriend :)

item.name: Ys
item.comment: I wasnt too keen on this game initially, but it has grown on me.

item.name: Yspahan
item.comment: Dice!

item.name: Zombie Dice
item.comment: Another mostly pointless throw away SJG game.
